title: SMB Meaning in Slang, Business, Tech & More

steps.title: Use SMB as shorthand for â€œsomebodyâ€ over text or on TikTok.
steps.content: Use SMB as shorthand for â€œsomebodyâ€ over text or on TikTok. Send SMB as a casual abbreviation for anyone, or to describe someone specific that you donâ€™t want to name directly (like if they'd rather not be mentioned or if you're feuding with them). [1] X Research source Using SMB to mean â€œsomebodyâ€ is most common among young people, but people of all ages can use the term. Itâ€™s mainly used online on apps like TikTok, but shows up over text and other sites, too. For example: â€œSmb tell me what they thought of this movie. Is it worth seeing?â€ â€œItâ€™s crazy when smb you thought was cool does you wrong ğŸ™„â€ [2] X Research source SMB was first used in place of "somebody" on TikTok in 2020, but became more common in 2023 as more young people started to use it.

steps.title: Use SMB when you need a rude comeback online or over text.
steps.content: Use SMB when you need a rude comeback online or over text. Although this meaning isnâ€™t as common as â€œsomebody,â€ using SMB for â€œsuck my b*llsâ€ is still a fixture of many text and comment threads. Sling it as a quick insult when you're annoyed or angry with someone and wants to express it (or just want to playfully razz them). [3] X Research source Them: â€œI can't believe you took the last seat in Stacy's car!â€ You: â€œSmb! First come, first serve!â€ Them: â€œCan you lend me $20?â€ You: â€œSMB! You never pay anyone back.â€

steps.title: In tech, an SMB is a file-sharing protocol thatâ€™s popular in workplaces.
steps.content: In tech, an SMB is a file-sharing protocol thatâ€™s popular in workplaces. With a server message block (SMB) protocol, people are able to access company files, printers, and other devices or resources from multiple computers or other devices. The SMB protocol was developed by IBM, one of the worldâ€™s biggest technology companies. [4] X Research source In IT, protocol is a set of rules that determine how devices send info and talk to each other on any given network. Popular systems like Windows, MacOS, iOS, Linux, and Android all use an SMB to share files and information across their networks. This meaning of SMB is one of the most common, and you're bound to see it frequently if you work in or closely with IT.

steps.title: In business, SMB refers to businesses with 25 to 500 employees.
steps.content: In business, SMB refers to businesses with 25 to 500 employees. If you see SMB in a company presentation, itâ€™s safe to assume the presenter is referring to a small-to-midsize business. In the professional world, an SMB usually has an annual revenue of less than $50 million, and some larger SMBs can reach up to 5,000 employees. Theyâ€™re considered the backbone of the economy, as most businesses across the world are SMBs that promote innovation. [5] X Research source Some SMBs make more than $50 million, but less than $1 billion. There is no agreed-upon definition of a small-to-midsize business, but they usually fall into these ranges. SMBs often struggle with building capital, maintaining talent, and accessing resources, but they combat these struggles with tight budgets, strong hiring incentives and federal government assistance.

steps.title: Use â€œsmbâ€ to apologize for something minor over text or online.
steps.content: Use â€œsmbâ€ to apologize for something minor over text or online. Using SMB in place of â€œSorry, my badâ€ isnâ€™t as common as other slang meanings, but it is still somewhat common among TikTok users. If a friend texts you saying that something you did upset them, for example, say â€œsmbâ€ to apologize. Follow it up by explaining your actions so that your apology is more genuine. Keep in mind that a quick apology over text works for minor or mostly unimportant things. If you're in a serious argument, a phone call or in-person chat is best. Them: â€œAre you running late again?â€ You: â€œSmb, I got held up by a work meeting. Be there soon!â€ Them: â€œUgh you ate all the chips!â€ You: â€œSmb I was so hungry when I got home ğŸ˜­â€

steps.title: Use SMB to refer to the Super Mario Bros franchise online.
steps.content: Use SMB to refer to the Super Mario Bros franchise online. SMB can refer to the classic Super Mario Bros video games as well as the movie, The Super Mario Bros . If youâ€™re talking to Mario fans online and need a quick way to mention the franchise, use SMB (in a forum or post about the games, folks will be able to tell this is what you mean from context). â€œCan't wait for the next SMB game!â€ â€œI've always loved gaming. SMB and Donkey Kong were huge for me.â€

steps.title: Use SMB when youâ€™re talking about the Super Meat Boy video game online.
steps.content: Use SMB when youâ€™re talking about the Super Meat Boy video game online. Super Meat Boy is a popular video game franchise from the 2010s. This meaning was a lot more common in the 2010s when the franchise had more popularity, but you may still occasionally see it in old forums or in reference to the game. â€œWow! I haven't played SMB in forever.â€ Them: â€œIâ€™ve been looking for a new game to play but Iâ€™m not having any luck.â€ You: â€œTry that old SMB game. Youâ€™ll be stuck on that for a while.â€

steps.title: A surface marker buoy (SMB) is a piece of scuba diving equipment.
steps.content: A surface marker buoy (SMB) is a piece of scuba diving equipment. The buoy is used by divers to mark where they're diving on the surface of the water. A diver will inflate the brightly colored, inflatable tube to signal their location or let others know they're in distress. This makes it easier for people and boat traffic to know where their whereabouts quickly. [6] X Research source If youâ€™re taking a scuba diving class and they mention SMBs, theyâ€™re talking about surface marker buoys, which are crucial for diver safety.
